There are $n$ cities and $m$ roads connecting them. Each road has a level of driver dissatisfaction, $w_i$, and a cost per unit of dissatisfaction reduction, $c_i$.  You have a budget of $S$ lamziks to spend on reducing dissatisfaction.

Your goal is to choose $n-1$ roads to be "main roads" such that:

* You can travel from any city to any other city using only the main roads.
* The total dissatisfaction of the main roads is minimized.

You can reduce the dissatisfaction of a road by any amount, even to negative values.

Output the minimum total dissatisfaction of the main roads and list the chosen main roads along with their final dissatisfaction levels.

You are given a network of cities connected by roads. Each road has a level of dissatisfaction and a cost to reduce that dissatisfaction. You need to choose a subset of roads to be "main roads" such that you can travel between any city and any other city using only the main roads.  You have a budget to spend on reducing the dissatisfaction of some roads.  Find the minimum total dissatisfaction of the main roads after spending your budget.
